name: Saltmarsh Flats
role_in_state: Lowland salt and tidal-fish supplier; labor reserve for coastal trade
economy_niches: Harvesting seaweeds and brackish reagents for ritual use
Seasonal labor provision for state ports
culture_adjustments: Kin-clan obligations outweigh formal guild membership
Daily labor paced by tidal rites and communal tide-keepers
Practical, low-draft seamanship (skiffs, rafts) specialized to mudflats
Informal barter networks stronger than coin economy
Local Coastal Tongues dialect with island creole influences
constraints: Soft ground prevents heavy industry or large docks
Dependence on imported ritual reagents and coastal trade
Seasonal access for larger vessels (shallow channels)
notes: Key source of state salt and brine-derived ritual reagents
Boundaries and usable flats shift with tidesâ€”ephemeral claims
Strong reserve of seasonal labor supports nearby shipyards
